name: engorgement
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of a part of the body that has become swollen or filled with a liquid, for example blood: vascular engorgement Cardiac disease can cause swelling of the ankles and engorgement of the jugular vein. See
engorged
More examplesFewer examplesThe engorgement of the lymph nodes with fluid will cause the nodes to contract regularly, moving the fluid around the body. Engorgement is common when breastfeeding, and can be painful. Congestion of venous flow in my leg caused ulcers, pain, and engorgement of the leg.
